svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - September 14 2024

title: "Week in Ethereum News
September 14, 2024" date: "2024-09-14"
Eth News and Links
Danny Ryan taking indefinite break, Pectra upgrade split proposed & cbBTC live
All core devs
â€¢ All Core Devs - Execution (ACDE) #196 : Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade: Pectra split proposed :
overall scope to remain the same, cap Pectra at devnet-3 spec to target Q1 2025, second upgrade with
PeerDAS & EOF to target H2 2025, agree split at ACDC Pectra-devnet-3 : live, validator consolidations
& EIP7702 work as expected and wallet devs can use to test EIP7702 EIP7685 execution layer requests :
explicit ordering & handling of invalid requests to be specified EIP7702 : minimal validity checks,
inline with existing transaction types EIP2537 BLS precompile: MSM precompiles need benchmarking with
concurrency disabled to see if gas cost should be doubled
â€¢ Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade: Pectra split proposed : overall scope to remain the same, cap
Pectra at devnet-3 spec to target Q1 2025, second upgrade with PeerDAS & EOF to target H2 2025, agree
split at ACDC Pectra-devnet-3 : live, validator consolidations & EIP7702 work as expected and wallet
devs can use to test EIP7702 EIP7685 execution layer requests : explicit ordering & handling of
invalid requests to be specified EIP7702 : minimal validity checks, inline with existing transaction
types EIP2537 BLS precompile: MSM precompiles need benchmarking with concurrency disabled to see if
gas cost should be doubled
â€¢ Pectra split proposed : overall scope to remain the same, cap Pectra at devnet-3 spec to target Q1
2025, second upgrade with PeerDAS & EOF to target H2 2025, agree split at ACDC
Pectra split proposed : overall scope to remain the same, cap Pectra at devnet-3 spec to target Q1
â€¢ Pectra-devnet-3 : live, validator consolidations & EIP7702 work as expected and wallet devs can use
to test EIP7702
Pectra-devnet-3 : live, validator consolidations & EIP7702 work as expected and wallet devs can use to
test EIP7702
â€¢ EIP7685 execution layer requests : explicit ordering & handling of invalid requests to be specified
EIP7685 execution layer requests : explicit ordering & handling of invalid requests to be specified
â€¢ EIP7702 : minimal validity checks, inline with existing transaction types
EIP7702 : minimal validity checks, inline with existing transaction types
â€¢ EIP2537 BLS precompile: MSM precompiles need benchmarking with concurrency disabled to see if gas
cost should be doubled
EIP2537 BLS precompile: MSM precompiles need benchmarking with concurrency disabled to see if gas cost
should be doubled
Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade
â€¢ Pectra testing call #4 : PeerDAS local devnet debugging ongoing
Fusaka (Osaka + Fulu) upgrade
â€¢ Verkle implementers call #24 : plan to evaluate binary tries & lean into tree-agnostic development
(in case ZK solution ready in similar timeframe to Verkle), discussed deletions, EOF/EIP7702 impact
and sync
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
â€¢ ðŸš¨ Lido at 28.2% , still too close to 33.3% threshold
ðŸš¨ Lido at 28.2% , still too close to 33.3% threshold
â€¢ Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth ~52% majority Consensus layer:
Prysm 37% Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
â€¢ Execution layer: Geth ~52% majority
Execution layer: Geth ~52% majority
â€¢ Consensus layer: Prysm 37%
Consensus layer: Prysm 37%
â€¢ Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
â€¢ Better geographic diversity is optimal, particularly outside of North America & Europe
Better geographic diversity is optimal, particularly outside of North America & Europe
Layer 1
â€¢ ePBS breakout #9 : slot auctions give out-of-protocol trusted advantage, new Engine API method to
request payloads by range and discussed moving withdrawals processing to execution phase
Research
â€¢ AUCIL : auction-based inclusion list, aggregator role auctioned off with winner proposing largest
inclusion list
Client Releases
â€¢ Execution layer: Erigon v2.60.7 : release process changes & Windows users need to build locally
â€¢ Erigon v2.60.7 : release process changes & Windows users need to build locally
Layer 2
â€¢ Optimism Granite upgrade reenabled permissionless fault proofs on OP Mainnet
Optimism Granite upgrade reenabled permissionless fault proofs on OP Mainnet
â€¢ OP Succinct : convert OP Stack chain to a zkEVM using SP1, 1 hour finality & ~1 cent per transaction
proving costs
OP Succinct : convert OP Stack chain to a zkEVM using SP1, 1 hour finality & ~1 cent per transaction
â€¢ ZKsync governance live, consists of token assembly, security council & guardians
ZKsync governance live, consists of token assembly, security council & guardians
â€¢ L2 safety : simplified view of L2Beat
L2 safety : simplified view of L2Beat
â€¢ RollCall #7 (L2 standards): L2s should shout blobspace needs as PeerDAS may ship after Pectra, Oasis
L2 transaction fee API & status specs and EIP7762 blob minimum price
RollCall #7 (L2 standards): L2s should shout blobspace needs as PeerDAS may ship after Pectra, Oasis
EIPs/Standards
â€¢ RIPs (rollup improvement proposals): RIP7767 : Gas to Ether precompile (GASBACK)
RIPs (rollup improvement proposals):
â€¢ RIP7767 : Gas to Ether precompile (GASBACK)
â€¢ ERCs (application layer): ERC7765 : Privileged NFTs tied to RWA (ERC721 extension) ERC7766 :
Signature aggregation for account abstraction (ERC4337)
ERCs (application layer):
â€¢ ERC7765 : Privileged NFTs tied to RWA (ERC721 extension)
ERC7765 : Privileged NFTs tied to RWA (ERC721 extension)
â€¢ ERC7766 : Signature aggregation for account abstraction (ERC4337)
ERC7766 : Signature aggregation for account abstraction (ERC4337)
Stuff for developers
â€¢ EVM Object Format (EOF) explainer : less stack-too-deep errors, lower cost execution, smaller
bytecode and can lead to better tooling
EVM Object Format (EOF) explainer : less stack-too-deep errors, lower cost execution, smaller bytecode
and can lead to better tooling
â€¢ Allegedly : Solidity compiler in TypeScript for EVM simulations
Allegedly : Solidity compiler in TypeScript for EVM simulations
â€¢ Moccasin : Vyper contract development framework, uses Python for scripts & tests, alpha
Moccasin : Vyper contract development framework, uses Python for scripts & tests, alpha
â€¢ CTFs: Secureum RACE #32: answers to 8 question Solidity quiz
CTFs:
â€¢ Secureum RACE #32: answers to 8 question Solidity quiz
â€¢ MEV searcher mines vanity transaction hash prefixes, function selector & call data Unsuccessful
attempt to reverse engineer the contract
MEV searcher mines vanity transaction hash prefixes, function selector & call data
â€¢ Unsuccessful attempt to reverse engineer the contract
Security
â€¢ Security notes on ERC4337 account abstraction
Ecosystem
â€¢ EF EIP4844 data challenge winners
EF EIP4844 data challenge winners
â€¢ Hackathon projects: ETHGlobal ETHOnline finalists and ETHWarsaw
Hackathon projects: ETHGlobal ETHOnline finalists and ETHWarsaw
Enterprise
â€¢ Visa: stablecoin usage in emerging markets & updated stablecoin dashboard
Visa: stablecoin usage in emerging markets & updated stablecoin dashboard
â€¢ EVE Frontier (space survival game) playtest planned on Redstone testnet
EVE Frontier (space survival game) playtest planned on Redstone testnet
Job Listings
â€¢ Gnosis seek CoreDevs , Sr Algorithm Engineer , Sr Smart Contract Engineer
Gnosis seek CoreDevs , Sr Algorithm Engineer , Sr Smart Contract Engineer
â€¢ Join Witnet as a Community Builder ! Full-time, remote opportunity.
Join Witnet as a Community Builder ! Full-time, remote opportunity.
â€¢ Status free.technology is hiring a Business Developer . More jobs at IFT!
Status free.technology is hiring a Business Developer . More jobs at IFT!
â€¢ Nomos is hiring Ecosystem Developer , Rust Engineer & Applied Researcher !
Nomos is hiring Ecosystem Developer , Rust Engineer & Applied Researcher !
Job listings: $600 for 4 issues (75 char limit). Pay using 3cities. Questions? abcoathup at-gmail
Onchain stats
â€¢ Fees (via ultrasound.money ): Gas: 0.6 to 28.1 gwei, 3.2 gwei average; zero net issuance at 24.1
gwei 16k ETH net issuance this week
Fees (via ultrasound.money ):
â€¢ Gas: 0.6 to 28.1 gwei, 3.2 gwei average; zero net issuance at 24.1 gwei
Gas: 0.6 to 28.1 gwei, 3.2 gwei average; zero net issuance at 24.1 gwei
â€¢ 16k ETH net issuance this week
16k ETH net issuance this week
â€¢ ETHUSD : $2,225 - $2,458, currently $2,437, all time high $4,878
ETHUSD : $2,225 - $2,458, currently $2,437, all time high $4,878
â€¢ ETHBTC : currently 0.04 (Flippening at ~0.164)
ETHBTC : currently 0.04 (Flippening at ~0.164)
Notable at app layer
â€¢ Coinbase cbBTC live on mainnet & Base; upgradeable, pausable & blacklistable
Coinbase cbBTC live on mainnet & Base; upgradeable, pausable & blacklistable
â€¢ PayPal & Venmo add ENS support, use ENS names in search when sending crypto
PayPal & Venmo add ENS support, use ENS names in search when sending crypto
â€¢ ZeroDev magic account : chain abstracted USDC on mainnet, Arbitrum, Optimism & Base
ZeroDev magic account : chain abstracted USDC on mainnet, Arbitrum, Optimism & Base
â€¢ Snapshot X : onchain voting using Starknet and storage proofs of mainnet holdings
Snapshot X : onchain voting using Starknet and storage proofs of mainnet holdings
â€¢ Friend Tech sent contract admin/ownership to zero address
Friend Tech sent contract admin/ownership to zero address
â€¢ Fractionalized CryptoPunk bought out for 10 ETH on Niftex (decommissioned platform)
Fractionalized CryptoPunk bought out for 10 ETH on Niftex (decommissioned platform)
Regulation/business/tokens
â€¢ US Financial Services subcommittee hearing: decoding DeFi
US Financial Services subcommittee hearing: decoding DeFi
â€¢ eToro $1.5M settlement with SEC, US users restricted to trading ETH & Bitcoin SEC used "crypto asset
securities" term despite telling a federal court they would stop
eToro $1.5M settlement with SEC, US users restricted to trading ETH & Bitcoin
â€¢ SEC used "crypto asset securities" term despite telling a federal court they would stop
â€¢ Robinhood $3.9M settlement with California DoJ for failing to allow crypto withdrawal
Robinhood $3.9M settlement with California DoJ for failing to allow crypto withdrawal
â€¢ Binance employee Tigran Gambaryan still held in Nigeria
Binance employee Tigran Gambaryan still held in Nigeria
General
â€¢ Danny Ryan taking an indefinite break from Ethereum L1 R&D
Danny Ryan taking an indefinite break from Ethereum L1 R&D
â€¢ Indodax (Indonesian centralized exchange) $25M stolen from hot wallets
Indodax (Indonesian centralized exchange) $25M stolen from hot wallets
â€¢ PIXHELL : malicious code can leak info from air gap computers via noise generated by pixels
PIXHELL : malicious code can leak info from air gap computers via noise generated by pixels
END OF SERVICE: plan to deprecate Week in Ethereum News
